nodes.bodyText:
does this actually read the collection? or uses collection cache.
Reading collection is expensive and we should be using CollectionCache.
Moved to using collectioncache
shouldn't this be concurrentHashMap as it is modified on a flatMap?
Did minor refactoring to ensure that these calls are only made once in the flatmap and no other thread is going to write on to this. Also made the rangeQueryMap unmodifiable
same about this one too. shouldn't this be thread-safe?
It will be modified only inside this flatmap and is called only once.

String, PartitionKey [](start = 63, length = 20)

Parameter order consistency w.r.t. other API's
This API is kind of different from the other we have. Still we are sort of consistent
Is a sync version of this contract also needed?
At the moment, I added async version, sync wrapper can be added quickly if required.
we added sync version too.
Thanks Mo for adding sync API. We have both sync and async API now.

Is BridgeInernal right place? May be a new targetted contract
BridgeInternal has lot of other contracts which might get attention.

thought on one of these options as the class name where this new method to be added?

ReadManyItems.java
Experimental.java
SpecialQuery.java

any thought? any suggestion on the class name?
Leaving it in the BridgeInternal until a decision is taken on where it should actually go
We moved it to ItemOperations

can we create the template of query using StringBuilder,  and use SqlQuerySpec and SqlParameter for passing id and pk values?
that way you don't have to worry about serializing the query and also it is safe against sql query injection attack?
Thank you for the suggestion, moved to use  SqlQuerySpec and SqlParameters, looks much cleaner and also helps handle some additional types without heave conversions
is this some leftover code? is this needed?
Yup. Deleted
Split handling: Do query layer take care?
DocumentProducer internally/recursively will handle split, if DocumentProducers correctly wired up no additional work for split proofing should be needed.
this only works on simple partition-key-path. I will improve this.
I addressed this one myself.
Nit: No need for this import.
will fix. ack.
Do we still need to fix this for gateway ?
later this needs to be fixed. for some reason doesn't work now.
